org.trianacode.taskgraph

Class TaskGraphUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.trianacode.taskgraph.TaskGraphUtils

  • public class TaskGraphUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility functions useful in handling task graphs

        public static Tool dummyCloneTool(Tool tool)
                           throws TaskException
        Creates a clone of the tool. If the tool is a taskgraph then a dummy single tool is returned
        Throws:
        TaskException

      • dummyCloneTask

        public static Task dummyCloneTask(Task task,
                  boolean preserveinst)
                           throws TaskException
        Creates a clone of the task. If the task is a taskgraph then a dummy single task is returned
        Throws:
        TaskException

      • createPlaceHolderTool

                                  throws TaskException
        Creates a place holder tool, which is a copy of only the nodes and tool classes of the specified tool.
        Throws:
        TaskException

      • cloneTaskGraph

        public static TaskGraph cloneTaskGraph(TaskGraph taskgraph,
                       TaskGraph parent,
                       boolean preserveinst)
                                throws TaskGraphException
        Creates a clone of the specified taskgraph within the parent, optionally preserving the instance ids of the cloned task.
        Throws:
        TaskGraphException

      • cloneTaskGraph

        public static TaskGraph cloneTaskGraph(TaskGraph taskgraph,
                       java.lang.String factorytype)
                                throws TaskGraphException
        Creates a full clone of the taskgraph, preserving the instances of the clone and all the tasks within the clone. Note that setParent() and init() are not called on the clone.
        Throws:
        TaskGraphException

      • semiCloneTaskGraph

        public static TaskGraph semiCloneTaskGraph(TaskGraph taskgraph,
                           java.lang.String factorytype)
                                    throws TaskGraphException
        Creates a semi-clone of the taskgraph, preserving the instances of the tasks within the the clone, but not the clone itself (i.e. the clone is a new taskgraph instance with the same contents). Note that the control task is not cloned. Also note that setParent() and init() are not called on the clone.
        Throws:
        TaskGraphException

      • copyTaskGraph

        public static TaskGraph copyTaskGraph(TaskGraph taskgraph,
                      java.lang.String factorytype)
                               throws TaskGraphException
        Creates a copy of the taskgraph, not preserving the instance id of the clone or the tasks within the clone. Note that setParent() and init() are not called on the clone.
        Throws:
        TaskGraphException

      • createTasks

        public static Task[] createTasks(Tool[] tools,
                 TaskGraph taskgraph,
                 boolean preserveinst)
                          throws TaskException,
                                 CableException
        Create new tasks in the specified taskgraph taskgraph, optionally preserving the original instance ids in the new tasks. Any connections between the specified tools are also created.
        Returns:
        the interfaces to the new tasks
        Throws:
        TaskException
        CableException

      • replaceTask

        public static Task replaceTask(Task curtask,
               Tool newtool,
               boolean rename)
                        throws TaskGraphException
        Replaces a current task with a new tool (instance id is preserved)
        Throws:
        TaskGraphException

      • replaceTask

        public static Task replaceTask(Task curtask,
               Tool newtool,
               boolean rename,
               boolean preserveinst)
                        throws TaskGraphException
        Replaces a current task with a new tool.

        Note that newtool is a task with no parent it is automatically disposed after the replacement task has been created.

        Parameters:
        curtask - the task being replaced
        newtool - the tool used to replace the existing task
        rename - true if the new task should take the same name as the existing task
        preserveinst - true if the new task should preseve the instance id of newtool
        Throws:
        TaskGraphException

      • disposeTool

        public static void disposeTool(Tool tool)
        Disposes of the specified tool if no longer required

      • getConnectedCables

        public static Cable[] getConnectedCables(Task task)
        Returns:
        an array of the cables connected to the specified task

      • getConnectedCables

        public static Cable[] getConnectedCables(Task[] tasklist)
        Returns:
        an array of the cables connected to the specified tasks (internal and external)

      • isConnectedCable

        public static boolean isConnectedCable(Cable cable,
                       Task task)
        Returns:
        true if a given cable is connected to a given task

      • isConnectedCable

        public static boolean isConnectedCable(Cable cable,
                       Task[] tasklist)
        Checks if a cable is connected to any task in an array of tasks

      • getInternalCables

        public static Cable[] getInternalCables(Task[] tasklist)
        Returns:
        the set of cables that are internal to a given set of tasks, i.e. only cables that connect two tasks in the input set.

      • isInternalCable

        public static boolean isInternalCable(Cable cable,
                      Task[] tasklist)
        Checks to see if a given cable is internal to a set of tasks, i.e. it connects two of the given tasks.

      • getExternalCables

        public static Cable[] getExternalCables(Task[] tasklist)
        Returns:
        the set of cables that are external to a given set of tasks, i.e. only cables that connect a task in the input set with one outside.

      • isExternalCable

        public static boolean isExternalCable(Cable cable,
                      Task[] tasklist)
        Checks to see if a given cable is external to a set of tasks, i.e. it connects a task in the input set with one outside.

      • getInputTasks

        public static Task[] getInputTasks(Task task)
        Returns:
        all the tasks that preceed the specified task

      • getOutputTasks

        public static Task[] getOutputTasks(Task task)
        Returns:
        all the tasks that follow the specified task

      • getConnectedTasks

        public static Task[] getConnectedTasks(Task task)
        Returns:
        all the tasks that are connected to the specified task

      • getRemainingWorkflow

        public static Task[] getRemainingWorkflow(Task task,
                          boolean include)
        Returns:
        the remaining workflow that follows the specified task, optionally including the original task at index 0.

      • connectControlTask

        public static void connectControlTask(TaskGraph taskgraph)
                               throws TaskGraphException
        Sets up the connections for the loop task. Input/output from the group now goes via the loop task.
        Throws:
        TaskGraphException

      • disconnectControlTask

        public static void disconnectControlTask(TaskGraph taskgraph)
                                  throws TaskGraphException
        Removes the connections for the loop task.
        Throws:
        TaskGraphException

      • getSourceNode

        public static Node getSourceNode(Node node)
        Returns:
        the ultimate source node that sends data to/receives data from the given node (ignoring control tasks). Null if not connected.

      • getAllTasksCount

        public static int getAllTasksCount(TaskGraph taskGraph,
                   boolean includecontrol)
        Returns:
        a count of all the tasks within a taskgraph and its sub taskgraphs (optionally including control tasks)

      • getAllTasksRecursive

        public static Task[] getAllTasksRecursive(TaskGraph taskGraph,
                          boolean includecontrol)
        Returns:
        an array of all tasks within a taskgraph and its sub taskgraphs, optionally including control tasks

      • getAllTasksRecursive

        public static void getAllTasksRecursive(TaskGraph taskGraph,
                        java.util.Vector copy,
                        boolean includecontrol)
        Recursively copy all the non-group tasks into the vector

        Returns:
        all the data types input by the nodes on the specified tool.
